text: Rennard Cordon Davis (May 23, 1940 â€“ February 2, 2021) was an American anti- war activist. He became known in the 1960s when he was one of the Chicago Seven protestors charged for anti-war protests at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago. He was a critic of the Vietnam War. Davis died on February 2, 2021, at his home in Berthoud, Colorado from lymphoma, aged 80. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American political activists Category:People from Lansing, Michigan Category:Deaths from lymphoma
title: Rennie Davis
